DISCOVER THE FAIRY & PIXIE VILLAGE

Officially opened by Cape Town Tourism on September 9, 2017

Featured on Kwela channel 144 on Dstv, April 2018, presented by Theresa Barnard.

Karavaan: New series to be featured on SABC 2 2022

Mama Pixie and her brother, George, were adopted by their grandparents and grew up on a farm “Mpanza” in KwaZulu-Natal. As a young girl she would spend many days and hours in the forests and rivers looking for the mythical river fairies from traditional Zulu folklore. Throughout her life, she has been fascinated by the silent world of fairies and pixies. 

The farm “Mpanza” has since been incorporated into the Zulu Kingdom and is no longer in the family’s hands. There is not much left of it today, but fond memories, broken dam walls, and the ruins of a once-proud Mpanza homestead. 

Mama Pixie found her inner peace by creating “The World-Class Attraction”: The Magical fantasy that is the “Pixie and Fairy Village.”

The “Pixie and Fairy Village” is unique by all standards and is a world-famous art attraction. Meals and accommodation are available on site. 

If you are lucky, you will meet Mama Pixie and her husband /artist Gerrie, one of the seven Dwarves”. She might tell you a story, a tale, a fairy tale that will leave you entranced and amazed at the positive energies and creative spirit of this living legend “ Mama Pixie” loved by many.

Contributing artists: Clifford Nooi, Dickson Andrew, Marcell Schoeman (Maximillan), Gerrie Maritz

Our story

HOW IT STARTED

The “Pixie and Fairy Village” is unique by all standards and is a world-famous art attraction. Meals and accommodation are available on site.

The Pixie and Fairy Village was featured on DSTV  on DSTV Channel 144 KykNET at 6pm on 29 April 2018 on Kwêla with Therese Benade and Hein Scholtz and was officially opened on 9 September 2017 by Cape Town Tourism.

Clifford Noi who has been an artist for 19 years, has lovingly created the Pixie Village with its many water features.  He has been inspired by books, movies and pictures whilst creating the Pixie Village which he feels has touched his soul.  Dixon Andrew is his apprentice and is also a local artist who sketches and paints.

An onsite shop sells various items including miniature “Pixie Villages” , fairies, pixies, dream catchers, incense, clothes and loads of other interesting items .

We graciously accept any donations of Pixies or Fairies to the Pixie Village!  Come visit us soon and feel the magic!

DO YOU BELIEVE IN FAIRIES?

Well….they are residing in The Pixie and Fairy Village, situated on the West Coast in Jacobs Bay.

This unique Pixie and Fairy Village was created from the whimsical imagination of ‘Pixie’ Maritz, who grew up on a family farm called Mpanza in Kwa-Zulu Natal, where according to local custom, it was where the “river fairies” inhabited the river banks.

As a child, Pixie grew up amid the misty forests, rivers and mountains on farmlands where her imagination flourished. Her deep love for this environment has manifested in the fantastical Village, capturing the imagination of young and old.

Spend time with the Pixies and Fairies amongst their natural forest environment and revel in the ongoing work of innovative artists.  Artists such as Clifford Noi, Trish Lazenby and Marcel Maximilian who have also contributed to the artwork.

Mama Pixie feels that each Pixie and Fairy in the Village has taken on a spirit of their own and has their own identity, she requests that children do not touch them, so as not to disturb their peaceful Village experience.
